title: Romantic Valentine prompt page with evasive “No” and “Good choice❤️” meme reveal

requirements.text: Create a single-page romantic Valentine prompt UI that asks the user: “Will you be my Valentine?” with two prominent options: “Yes” and “No”.

quotes:
Create an interactive web page as a surprise for my girlfriend... to ask her to be my Valentine.
There should be two options: Yes or No.

acceptanceCriteria: The page shows the question text “Will you be my Valentine?” in English.
Two buttons are visible and labeled exactly “Yes” and “No”.
The page has no additional primary flows beyond answering the Valentine prompt.

requirements.text: Implement the “No” option as an evasive button: when the user attempts to interact with it (mouse hover/pointer enter on desktop; touch attempt on iPad), it moves to a new on-screen position so it cannot be clicked.

quotes: When she hovers her cursor over No, it should move away so she cannot click it, forcing her to click only on Yes.

acceptanceCriteria: On pointer hover/enter, the “No” button relocates away from the pointer and remains within the visible viewport.
On touch devices (iPad Chrome), attempting to tap the “No” button causes it to move before a click/selection is registered.
It is not possible to successfully click the “No” button under normal use.

requirements.text: When the user clicks “Yes”, replace the prompt with a celebratory reveal that displays a meme-style image containing the text “Good choice❤️”.

quotes: When she clicks Yes, show her a meme image telling her "Good choice❤️".

acceptanceCriteria: Clicking “Yes” reliably transitions the UI into a success/reveal state.
The reveal state displays a meme image that includes the text “Good choice❤️”.
After the reveal, the evasive “No” interaction is no longer shown/needed.

requirements.text: Apply a romantic-themed visual design using a pink and white color scheme, with responsive layout that works well on iPad Chrome in both portrait and landscape.

quotes: The page should be themed romantically with a pink and white color scheme and be fully interactive... run it on my iPad using Chrome.

acceptanceCriteria: The page uses a cohesive pink/white romantic theme (background, typography, button styling).
UI elements remain readable and usable on iPad-sized viewports without horizontal scrolling.
The main content is centered and visually balanced in both portrait and landscape.

requirements.text: Add the required generated meme image as a static frontend asset and render it directly from the frontend (do not fetch it from the backend).

quotes: show her a meme image telling her "Good choice❤️".

acceptanceCriteria: The meme image file exists under frontend/public/assets/generated and is referenced by the frontend via a static path.
The image loads correctly in the reveal state without any backend calls.

constraints: Do not modify files under frontend/src/components/ui.
Do not modify immutable hook and bootstrap files (frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx).
No external databases or third-party auth providers; keep the experience fully client-side for this page.
nonGoals: Implementing real authentication or user accounts.
Persisting the answer to the backend or storing analytics.
Adding additional pages, routing, or complex app features beyond the Valentine prompt and reveal.

required: Meme-style image with bold caption text “Good choice❤️”, romantic pink/white aesthetic (valentine-good-choice-meme.dim_1024x1024.png)

preferencesToAdd: Use English for any user-facing text in the build request.
